```python
>>> import pandas as pd
>>> import nltk
>>> from nltk.sentiment.vader import SentimentIntensityAnalyzer
>>> nltk.download('vader_lexicon')

>>> from pugnlp.segmentation import generate_sentences_from_files
>>> df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(generate_sentences_from_files('/home/hobs/Dropbox/notes/journal', ['md', 'txt']))
>>> df.to_csv('/home/hobs/Dropbox/notes/journal/sentences.csv.gz')
>>> df.size = df.size.astype(int)
>>> df.len = df.sentence.str.len().astype(int)
>>> df.describe()
          mode          size           len
count   6238.0   6238.000000   6238.000000
mean   33204.0   7110.678262    163.872876
std        0.0   8182.218519    367.429455
min    33204.0      0.000000      0.000000
25%    33204.0   2092.000000     56.000000
50%    33204.0   4192.000000    101.000000
75%    33204.0   8922.000000    173.000000
max    33204.0  39511.000000  12202.000000
>>> sia = SentimentIntensityAnalyzer()
>>> sia.polarity_scores(df.sentence.loc[0])
{'compound': 0.0, 'neg': 0.0, 'neu': 1.0, 'pos': 0.0}
>>> sentiment = pd.DataFrame([sia.polarity_scores(s) for s in df.sentence])
>>> df = pd.concat((df, sentiment), axis=1)
>>> df.describe()
          mode     size           len    num_words     compound          neg  \
count   6238.0   6238.0   6238.000000  6238.000000  6238.000000  6238.000000   
mean   33204.0  68618.0    163.872876    27.825104     0.092470     0.061760   
std        0.0      0.0    367.429455    53.493492     0.424772     0.115089   
min    33204.0  68618.0      0.000000     0.000000    -0.994400     0.000000   
25%    33204.0  68618.0     56.000000    10.000000    -0.025800     0.000000   
50%    33204.0  68618.0    101.000000    18.000000     0.000000     0.000000   
75%    33204.0  68618.0    173.000000    30.750000     0.401900     0.092000   
max    33204.0  68618.0  12202.000000  1650.000000     0.998400     1.000000   

               neu          pos  
count  6238.000000  6238.000000  
mean      0.845360     0.092721  
std       0.160947     0.129721  
min       0.000000     0.000000  
25%       0.755000     0.000000  
50%       0.875000     0.025500  
75%       1.000000     0.150000  
max       1.000000     1.000000  
>>> df.to_csv('/home/hobs/Dropbox/notes/journal/sentence_sentiment.csv.gz')

>>> plt.show()
>>> df2[['created']].plot(style='.', c='g')
>>> import dateutil
>>> parse_dt = dateutil.parser
>>> parse_dt('2016-01-01')
>>> parse_dt.datetime('2016-01-01')
>>> parse_dt.parse('2016-01-01')
datetime.datetime(2016, 1, 1, 0, 0)
```
